account.externalId.description: Select the appropriate account for inventory adjustments. Usually, this will be an expense account.For details on accounts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > Chart of Accounts.
account.externalId.name: account.externalId

account.internalId.description: Select the appropriate account for inventory adjustments. Usually, this will be an expense account.For details on accounts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > Chart of Accounts.
account.internalId.name: account.internalId

account.name.description: Select the appropriate account for inventory adjustments. Usually, this will be an expense account.For details on accounts, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_ACCOUNT_> > Chart of Accounts.
account.name.name: account.name

adjLocation.externalId.description: To select the location to associate with this adjustment transaction:   1. Select New to enter a new location.   2. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for information on existing locations.Note: You can select locations for items on the Adjustments subtab.
adjLocation.externalId.name: adjLocation.externalId

adjLocation.internalId.description: To select the location to associate with this adjustment transaction:   1. Select New to enter a new location.   2. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for information on existing locations.Note: You can select locations for items on the Adjustments subtab.
adjLocation.internalId.name: adjLocation.internalId

adjLocation.name.description: To select the location to associate with this adjustment transaction:   1. Select New to enter a new location.   2. Go to <_TABNAME=LIST_LOCATION_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_LOCATION_> > Locations for information on existing locations.Note: You can select locations for items on the Adjustments subtab.
adjLocation.name.name: adjLocation.name

customer.externalId.description: If this inventory adjustment is a project-related cost but is not specifically billed as a line item, select the appropriate customer or project.For example, when a caterer bills his or her customers a per person rate for a beer and wine bar, they can then enter an inventory adjustment to account for the actual number of bottles consumed.
customer.externalId.name: customer.externalId

customer.internalId.description: If this inventory adjustment is a project-related cost but is not specifically billed as a line item, select the appropriate customer or project.For example, when a caterer bills his or her customers a per person rate for a beer and wine bar, they can then enter an inventory adjustment to account for the actual number of bottles consumed.
customer.internalId.name: customer.internalId

customer.name.description: If this inventory adjustment is a project-related cost but is not specifically billed as a line item, select the appropriate customer or project.For example, when a caterer bills his or her customers a per person rate for a beer and wine bar, they can then enter an inventory adjustment to account for the actual number of bottles consumed.
customer.name.name: customer.name

department.externalId.description: Select a department to associate with this transaction.To create a new department, select New.For details on existing departments, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments.
department.externalId.name: department.externalId

department.internalId.description: Select a department to associate with this transaction.To create a new department, select New.For details on existing departments, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments.
department.internalId.name: department.internalId

department.name.description: Select a department to associate with this transaction.To create a new department, select New.For details on existing departments, go to <_TABNAME=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > <_TASKCATEGORY=LIST_DEPARTMENT_> > Departments.
department.name.name: department.name

estimatedTotalValue.description: This is the total value of the change in your inventory.When you submit the adjustment, the current cost is determined from your inventory database and your adjustment totals are updated.
estimatedTotalValue.name: estimatedTotalValue

location.externalId.description: Select a location to associate with this assembly. Select New to enter a new location.Go to Lists > Locations for details about existing locations.
location.externalId.name: location.externalId

location.internalId.description: Select a location to associate with this assembly. Select New to enter a new location.Go to Lists > Locations for details about existing locations.
location.internalId.name: location.internalId

location.name.description: Select a location to associate with this assembly. Select New to enter a new location.Go to Lists > Locations for details about existing locations.
location.name.name: location.name

memo.description: Enter an optional memo for this adjustment. It will appear on a register or Account Detail report.
memo.name: memo

postingPeriod.externalId.description: Select the period you want to post this inventory adjustment to.If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.
postingPeriod.externalId.name: postingPeriod.externalId

postingPeriod.internalId.description: Select the period you want to post this inventory adjustment to.If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.
postingPeriod.internalId.name: postingPeriod.internalId

postingPeriod.name.description: Select the period you want to post this inventory adjustment to.If a period is closed, you cannot post to that period.
postingPeriod.name.name: postingPeriod.name

subsidiary.externalId.description: If you have a NetSuite OneWorld account, select a Subsidiary from the list.
subsidiary.externalId.name: subsidiary.externalId

subsidiary.internalId.description: If you have a NetSuite OneWorld account, select a Subsidiary from the list.
subsidiary.internalId.name: subsidiary.internalId

subsidiary.name.description: If you have a NetSuite OneWorld account, select a Subsidiary from the list.
subsidiary.name.name: subsidiary.name

tranDate.description: Today's date autofills as the date of this inventory adjustment.You can enter or choose another date.
tranDate.name: tranDate

tranId.description: Enter an optional reference number for this inventory adjustment.Reference Numbers for inventory adjustments do not have to be consecutive.You can enter a maximum of 45 characters in this field.
tranId.name: tranId

type.value.description: If this inventory adjustment is a project-related cost but is not specifically billed as a line item, select the appropriate customer or project.For example, when a caterer bills his or her customers a per person rate for a beer and wine bar, they can then enter an inventory adjustment to account for the actual number of bottles consumed.
type.value.name: type.value
